t: Numbers 26
The Second Census
After*p the plague, the Lord*s said to Moses and Eleazar son of Aaron the priest,
“Take a census of the entire Israelite community by their ancestral families of those twenty years old or more who can serve in Israel’s army.”
So*p Moses and the priest Eleazar said to them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho,
“Take a census of those twenty years old or more, as the Lord*s had commanded Moses and the Israelites who came out of the land of Egypt.”
Reuben*ln was the firstborn of Israel. Reuben’s*ln descendants: the*ln Hanochite clan from Hanoch; the*ln Palluite clan from Pallu;
the*ln Hezronite clan from Hezron; the*ln Carmite clan from Carmi.
These*ln were the Reubenite clans, and*ln their registered men numbered 43,730.
The*ln son of Pallu was Eliab.
The*ln sons of Eliab were Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. (It*p was Dathan and Abiram, chosen by the community, who fought against Moses and Aaron; they and Korah’s followers fought against the Lord.*s
The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them with Korah, when his followers died and the fire consumed 250 men. They serve as a warning sign.
The sons of Korah, however, did not die.)
Simeon’s*ln descendants by their clans: the*ln Nemuelite clan from Nemuel; the*ln Jaminite clan from Jamin; the*ln Jachinite clan from Jachin;
the*ln Zerahite clan from Zerah; the*ln Shaulite clan from Shaul.
These*ln were the Simeonite clans, numbering 22,200 men.
Gad’s*ln descendants by their clans: the*ln Zephonite clan from Zephon; the*ln Haggite clan from Haggi; the*ln Shunite clan from Shuni;
the*ln Oznite clan from Ozni; the*ln Erite clan from Eri;
the*ln Arodite clan from Arod; the*ln Arelite clan from Areli.
These*ln were the Gadite clans numbered by their registered men: 40,500.
Judah’s*p sons included Er and Onan, but they died in the land of Canaan.
Judah’s descendants by their clans: the*ln Shelanite clan from Shelah; the*ln Perezite clan from Perez; the*ln Zerahite clan from Zerah.
The*ln descendants of Perez: the*ln Hezronite clan from Hezron; the*ln Hamulite clan from Hamul.
These*ln were Judah’s clans numbered by their registered men: 76,500.
Issachar’s*ln descendants by their clans: the*ln Tolaite clan from Tola; the*ln Punite clan from Puvah;
the*ln Jashubite clan from Jashub; the*ln Shimronite clan from Shimron.
These*ln were Issachar’s clans numbered by their registered men: 64,300.
Zebulun’s*ln descendants by their clans: the*ln Seredite clan from Sered; the*ln Elonite clan from Elon; the*ln Jahleelite clan from Jahleel.
These*ln were the Zebulunite clans numbered by their registered men: 60,500.
Joseph’s*ln descendants by their clans from Manasseh and Ephraim:
Manasseh’s*ln descendants: the*ln Machirite clan from Machir. Machir*ln fathered Gilead; the*ln Gileadite clan from Gilead.
These*ln were Gilead’s descendants: the*ln Iezerite clan from Iezer; the*ln Helekite clan from Helek;
the*ln Asrielite clan from Asriel; the*ln Shechemite clan from Shechem;
the*ln Shemidaite clan from Shemida; the*ln Hepherite clan from Hepher;
Zelophehad*p son of Hepher had no sons - only daughters. The names of Zelophehad’s daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
These*ln were Manasseh’s clans, numbered by their registered men: 52,700.
These*ln were Ephraim’s descendants by their clans: the*ln Shuthelahite clan from Shuthelah; the*ln Becherite clan from Becher; the*ln Tahanite clan from Tahan.
These*ln were Shuthelah’s descendants: the*ln Eranite clan from Eran.
These*ln were the Ephraimite clans numbered by their registered men: 32,500. These*ln were Joseph’s descendants by their clans.
Benjamin’s*ln descendants by their clans: the*ln Belaite clan from Bela; the*ln Ashbelite clan from Ashbel; the*ln Ahiramite clan from Ahiram;
the*ln Shuphamite clan from Shupham; the*ln Huphamite clan from Hupham.
Bela’s*ln descendants from Ard and Naaman: the*ln Ardite clan from Ard; the*ln Naamite clan from Naaman.
These*ln were the Benjaminite clans numbered by their registered men: 45,600.
These*ln were Dan’s descendants by their clans: the*ln Shuhamite clan from Shuham. These*ln were the clans of Dan by their clans.
All*ln the Shuhamite clans numbered by their registered men: 64,400.
Asher’s*ln descendants by their clans: the*ln Imnite clan from Imnah; the*ln Ishvite clan from Ishvi; the*ln Beriite clan from Beriah.
From*ln Beriah’s descendants: the*ln Heberite clan from Heber; the*ln Malchielite clan from Malchiel.
And*ln the name of Asher’s daughter was Serah.
These*ln were the Asherite clans numbered by their registered men: 53,400.
Naphtali’s*ln descendants by their clans: the*ln Jahzeelite clan from Jahzeel; the*ln Gunite clan from Guni;
the*ln Jezerite clan from Jezer; the*ln Shillemite clan from Shillem.
These*ln were the Naphtali clans numbered by their registered men: 45,400.
These*ln registered Israelite men numbered 601,730.
The*p Lord*s spoke to Moses,
“The land is to be divided among them as an inheritance based on the number of names.
Increase the inheritance for a large tribe and decrease it for a small one. Each is to be given its inheritance according to those who were registered in it.
The land is to be divided by lot; they will receive an inheritance according to the names of their ancestral tribes.
Each inheritance will be divided by lot among the larger and smaller tribes.”
These*ln were the Levites registered by their clans: the*ln Gershonite clan from Gershon; the*ln Kohathite clan from Kohath; the*ln Merarite clan from Merari.
These*ln were the Levite family groups: the*ln Libnite clan, the*ln Hebronite clan, the*ln Mahlite clan, the*ln Mushite clan, and*ln the Korahite clan. Kohath*p was the ancestor of Amram.
The name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed, a descendant of Levi, born to Levi in Egypt. She bore to Amram: Aaron, Moses, and their sister Miriam.
Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar were born to Aaron,
but Nadab and Abihu died when they presented unauthorized fire before the Lord.*s
Those registered were 23,000, every male one month old or more; they were not registered among the other Israelites, because no inheritance was given to them among the Israelites.
These*p were the ones registered by Moses and the priest Eleazar when they registered the Israelites on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
But among them there was not one of those who had been registered by Moses and the priest Aaron when they registered the Israelites in the Wilderness of Sinai.
For the Lord*s had said to them that they would all die in the wilderness. None of them was left except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
